Title: MoveCube
Description: - Write MoveCube(); (with a semicolon, this is important!).
Tips: Just write MoveCube(); between the curly brackets, it's easy! :)

Title: Write Hello World!
Description: - You need to call the WriteLine() method of the Console(Console.WriteLine) class and pass the Hello World!
Tips: The print method is called like this: Console.WriteLine(...);
Instead of a ellipsis, write "Hello, World!"

Title: Opening the door
Description:
- Declare a keyNumber variable of type int with value 55. The variable is declared like this:
 type name = value;
Tips: To declare a variable, specify its type - int...
To set a value, write = after the name and the desired value.

Title: Take Feed
Description:
- Correct a typo in the code to take a package of food by weight in kilograms.
You need to take a box weighing 0.5 kg.
When a variable is declared with the var keyword, its type is determined automatically, based on the data assigned during initialization. 
When an integer is divided by an integer, the result is an integer without a remainder
5-integer
5.0f,float (float)
5.0 fraction(double)
Tips: Recall the result of dividing a whole number by another number.

Title: How many days will the food last
Description:
- In this task, you have to calculate how many days (not counting today) you will have enough food, provided that you feed the fish today.
The method is passed the number of 2 types of fish, the daily norm for them and the amount of food. You need to return the number of days the food will last (excluding today's feeding).
 To convert a double to an int when assigning or passing to a method, precede the value with (int)
Tips: Find out how much food the first kind of fish need - multiply their number by the daily rate and write it in a new variable.
Do this for two kinds of fish.
To get the remainder, subtract from the total amount of feed what you counted before

Title: Count the number of glasses
Description:
- You need to calculate the number of glasses needed to cook the dish.
 You are given the required volumes of flour and water, as well as the volume of the glass.
To round up, use the Math.Ceiling() method.
Tips: Number of glasses = Product volume / Cup volume

Title: Add/Reduce Temperature
Description:
- You need to implement two methods to add and subtract the temperature.
 You can do this by manipulating the variable T.
 Consider that the variable is already declared outside of the method (we'll discuss how to do this later).
Tips: In the AddT method, add a deltaT value to T
In the SubstractT method, subtract the deltaT value from T

Title: Shared or not
Description:
- You need to determine whether the transferred amount is divisible by 4 and return the remainder of the division (if the remainder is 0).
 Remainder of the division: divisible%quotient
Tips: Perform division with a remainder and return what you got
